name: Brazilian Hearts of Palm Pastries
author: Gi_BR
summary: These Brazilian pastries (folhadinho de palmito) are super easy to make and the palm hearts filling is delicious, but you can really use any filling of your choice for this recipe! [Recipe originally submitted to Allrecipes.com.br]
ingredients: 1 (7 ounce) can hearts of palm, cubed
salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 (17.5 ounce) package frozen puff pastry, thawed
directions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat
Add onion and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes
Add tomatoes and hearts of palm; saute until tender, about 5 minutes
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Dissolve cornmeal in a bowl of milk; mix well and pour into the skillet with the hearts of palm
Cook, stirring constantly, until flavors meld, about 5 minutes more
Add cream cheese and chives; stir well to dissolve the cheese
Roll pastry out onto a floured work surface
Place 1 tablespoon of the filling on each pastry square
Fold pastry over the filling and seal
Place pastries on a baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until golden, about 40 minutes
